caption.p: Revisions to Standard Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Workflow with Potential Problems and Suggested Solutions

tr.td: Communicating instructions to pause or resume CPR by external team Communicating the presence or absence of a pulse by internal team
Increased dead space and delay in delivery Inadvertent disconnection of intravenous tubing
Low-volume, microbore tubing Periodic monitoring of intravenous connections by internal team
Dilution of laboratory sample Theoretical risk of viral transmission in blood
Low-volume, microbore tubing Measurement of tubing volume to determine wasted blood before drawing laboratory sample Protective equipment (gloves, mask) while drawing laboratory samples
Communicating “all clear” by external team Communicating acknowledgement of “all clear” by internal team
Communicating confirmation of endotracheal intubation by external team to proceduralist
